snippet: NeuroVigil’s iBrain may help people with A.L.S., like Stephen Hawking, communicate using advanced machine-brain interfaces.
abstract: iBrain, device designed by San Diego company NeuroVigil, is part of a new generation of portable neural devices and algorithms intended to monitor and diagnose conditions like sleep apnea, depression and autism; device uses a single channel to pick up waves of electrical brain signals; iBrain is now being used in an experimental capacity by Dr Stephen Hawking, long paralyzed by ALS, to see if it can eventually convert his thought patterns into computer commands or synthesized speech.
lead_paragraph: NeuroVigil’s iBrain may help people with A.L.S., like Stephen Hawking, communicate using advanced machine-brain interfaces.
